physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features the front view of a car, with the license plate seen, and a number '4' near the two front lights. It is stationary by the side of a road. Several men are standing around the car, looking at it. There is a crowd of people seen in the background. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" PSixteen Months in Singapore: hotograph of people examining a car
subject_terms_1: races (events) automobile racing spectators (event observers) snapshots
